.
INPUT ( prompt first and after text description ) :
upscale image, correct details and mistake of image

nodes.title: INSTRUCTIONS
widgets_values:
INSTRUCTIONS :

LLM #3  CINEMATIC MOTION GENERATOR (Extended Example with Dialogue)
Input needed:

Image prompts from LLM #2 (line by line, no breaks)
Original narrative from LLM #1 (for context, dialogue, and emotional beats)
Style (if specified - must match the style from LLM #2)
Title (the film/story title)

Instructions:
Transform each static image prompt into a cinematic video prompt with camera movement, environmental motion, character actions, and integrated dialogue. Every video will be exactly 5 seconds long.
CRITICAL FORMATTING RULES:

Output prompts line by line with absolutely NO LINE BREAKS between them
NO numbering, NO scene markers, NO chapter divisions
NO blank lines separating prompts anywhere in your output
Each prompt = one continuous line of text that ends, then immediately the next prompt begins on the following line
DO NOT use "Next shot:" or any prefixstart directly with describing what happens in the shot
Begin each prompt by describing the camera movement or how the shot begins
If a style was provided in the input, add it at the END of every single prompt (must match LLM #2's style)
THE VERY FIRST PROMPT = TITLE CARD ANIMATION - describe how the title card comes to life with subtle motion

Title Card Animation Rules (FIRST PROMPT ONLY):

Transform the static title card from LLM #2 into a moving sequence
Add subtle environmental motion (dust floating, light flickering, shadows shifting, textures breathing)
Keep it atmospheric and mood-setting, not action-heavy
Duration is still 5 seconds
Example: "The ancient parchment texture fills the frame as golden symbols pulse and glow with breathing rhythm in the corners, candlelight flickers and dances across the weathered surface creating shifting shadows, dust motes drift slowly through the warm light"

Cinematic Camera Language (use precise terminology):

Camera movements: push in, pull back, dolly left, dolly right, crane up, crane down, tilt up, tilt down, pan left, pan right, slow zoom in, slow zoom out, rack focus (from X to Y), handheld follow, tracking shot, steadicam glide
Camera speeds: slow, gentle, gradual, rapid, sudden, smooth, jarring
Camera positions: eye level, low angle, high angle, overhead, bird's eye, worm's eye, Dutch angle, over-the-shoulder
Use combinations: "a slow dolly forward combined with a gentle tilt down" or "rapid pan right that settles into a push in"

Environmental Motion (add life to every shot):

Atmospheric: dust motes floating through light beams, candle flames flickering and dancing, smoke drifting, steam rising, shadows shifting and lengthening
Weather: if outdoorsleaves rustling, grass swaying, clouds moving, rain falling
Objects: fabric moving in breeze, papers rustling, liquid rippling, objects settling
Lighting changes: light sources brightening or dimming, colored light washing across surfaces, shadows crawling

Character Micro-Movements (add humanity and tension):

Eyes: darting between objects, widening, narrowing, blinking, pupils dilating
Hands: fingers trembling, gripping, releasing, gestures starting or stopping
Body: weight shifting, posture changing, breathing visible (chest rising/falling, shoulders moving)
Face: expressions forming gradually, muscles tensing, jaw clenching
Small actions: swallowing, inhaling sharply, leaning forward or back

Dialogue Integration:

When characters speak (check the LLM #1 narrative for exact dialogue), integrate it naturally into the shot description
Format: describe what's happening visually, then add "Marcus says 'I found it exactly where the manuscript said it would be' as he..." and continue the visual description
The dialogue happens simultaneously with the action, not separately
Match the timing: in a 5-second shot, a short line can be spoken while other action continues; a longer line might be the main event

MAIN CHARACTER DESCRIPTION RULE (CRITICAL):

If there is a main character or any named character in the scene, you MUST include their full physical description in EVERY SINGLE PROMPT where they appear
Character names alone are NOT sufficient - each prompt is independent and must be self-contained
Include age, hair (color, length, style), eye color, clothing (with specific details), and any distinctive physical features
Keep descriptions concise but precise - aim for one flowing sentence that captures their complete appearance
Example: Instead of "Marcus steps backward", write "Marcus (late sixties, white beard to chest, round brass spectacles, brown tweed jacket with leather elbow patches over cream cable-knit sweater) steps backward"
This applies to EVERY prompt where the character is visible, including wide shots, medium shots, and close-ups
If multiple characters appear in a prompt, describe ALL of them fully
The description should flow naturally within the action description

Continuity Rules (CRITICAL):

Each video shot must flow logically from the previous one
Maintain character positions: if Sarah was on the right side of the table, she's still there unless you show her moving
Track props precisely: if a candle was visible on the left corner, it remains there
Lighting must stay consistent unless motivated by story (candles flaring is motivated; random sunlight appearing is not)
Spatial geography must be respected: if the doorway was on the left, it stays on the left
Character clothing and appearance cannot change
Environmental details persist: the bookshelves, flagstones, sconces, archwaythese are fixed
Each 5-second shot should feel like part of one continuous scene, not disconnected moments

Pacing & Rhythm:

5 seconds is shortdescribe motion that naturally fills that duration
Some shots can be slow and contemplative (a gentle push-in on a face)
Some shots can be dynamic and rapid (a quick pan that whips across the room)
Vary your pacing: slow-slow-fast-slow creates rhythm
Allow some shots to be mostly still with subtle motion (a held frame where only candles flicker and breathing is visible)

Age Restriction Rule:

You cannot depict children or minors in any prompts
If the source material includes a child character, describe them as a young adult (18+) instead
Adjust age descriptions appropriately: "young adult" instead of "child", "early twenties" instead of "teenager"

Style Tag Rule:

If a style was specified in the input (e.g., "Realistic style", "Cartoon style", "Anime style"), you MUST append it to the end of EVERY prompt
The style must match exactly what LLM #2 used
Format: end each prompt with a period, then the style tag
Example: "...dust motes drifting through golden light beams. Realistic style"

Output format (no breaks between lines):
The ancient parchment texture fills the frame as golden mystical symbols pulse and glow with slow breathing rhythm in the corners, candlelight flickers and dances across the weathered surface creating shifting shadows that crawl and recede, dust motes drift lazily through the warm amber light while the atmosphere builds mystery and anticipation. Realistic style
A slow forward dolly glides through the ancient library interior, starting wide on the towering black oak bookshelves that recede upward into darkness and pushing gradually toward the center where Professor Marcus (late sixties, white beard to chest, round brass spectacles, brown tweed jacket with leather elbow patches over cream cable-knit sweater) stands bent over the massive wooden table, golden light from the ancient map pulsing upward onto his face in a breathing rhythm while candlelight from iron sconces flickers across gray flagstone floors and dust motes drift lazily through the beams of light. Realistic style
The camera tilts down in a smooth arc to follow Marcus's (late sixties, white beard to chest, round brass spectacles, brown tweed jacket with leather elbow patches over cream cable-knit sweater) weathered hands as his spotted fingers carefully unfold the yellowed animal-skin map across the wooden table surface, the golden geometric symbols beginning to glow and pulse beneath his touch like living things breathing light, his fingertips trembling slightly with age or perhaps anticipation as candle flames dance in soft focus at the edge of frame, Marcus whispers "Three centuries it's been hidden" as his voice carries reverence and awe. Realistic style
A gentle pan right sweeps across the library to the arched stone doorway on the left where Sarah (mid-twenties, shoulder-length copper-red hair, bright green eyes, worn brown leather jacket with asymmetric zippers over gray cotton shirt, dark jeans, leather boots) enters from the shadowed corridor beyond, her leather boots making soft echoing sounds against flagstones as she walks forward into the candlelight which catches strands of her red hair and makes them glow almost copper, her eyes already fixed on the golden light emanating from the table ahead. Realistic style
A slow crane shot rises smoothly above the wooden table to reveal the glowing map from an overhead perspective, golden symbols shifting and spiraling across the yellowed parchment surface in hypnotic patterns, Marcus (late sixties, white beard to chest, round brass spectacles, brown tweed jacket with leather elbow patches over cream cable-knit sweater) visible standing on the near side with his hands spread on the table and Sarah (mid-twenties, shoulder-length copper-red hair, bright green eyes, worn brown leather jacket with asymmetric zippers over gray cotton shirt, dark jeans, leather boots) approaching from the far side, their long shadows stretching across the gray flagstones in opposite directions cast by the pulsing golden light between them, the iron sconces flickering on the stone walls in the background. Realistic style
The camera pushes in gradually on Sarah's (mid-twenties, shoulder-length copper-red hair, bright green eyes, worn brown leather jacket with asymmetric zippers over gray cotton shirt, dark jeans, leather boots) face as she leans forward over the table, the golden glow from the map below illuminating her features with eerie uplight that emphasizes her cheekbones and the bridge of her nose, her green eyes widening with wonder as the moving symbols reflect and dance across her irises, strands of red hair falling forward past her cheeks while her lips part slightly in amazement, Marcus says "I found it exactly where the manuscript said it would be" as his voice echoes softly in the vast space and Sarah's gaze never leaves the glowing parchment. Realistic style
A slow dolly right circles around to capture Marcus's (late sixties, white beard to chest, round brass spectacles, brown tweed jacket with leather elbow patches over cream cable-knit sweater) profile in medium shot, candlelight from the nearest iron sconce catching the side of his face and making his round brass spectacles gleam as he straightens up from his bent position, the deep lines and wrinkles in his face becoming more prominent as his expression shifts from excitement to concern, his bushy white eyebrows drawing together above the frames of his spectacles while the golden light from the map continues to pulse rhythmically across his tweed jacket. Realistic style
The camera plunges into an extreme close-up of the map's surface, filling the entire frame with the ancient yellowed animal-skin parchment texture, golden geometric symbols swirling and spiraling inward toward the center in mesmerizing patterns, each symbol pulsing with its own breathing rhythm of light that intensifies and dims in waves, the texture of the aged skin visible beneath the glowing lines with tiny cracks and discolorations adding age and authenticity. Realistic style
A slow push in focuses on Sarah's (mid-twenties, shoulder-length copper-red hair, bright green eyes, worn brown leather jacket with asymmetric zippers over gray cotton shirt, dark jeans, leather boots) right hand and extended finger as they move forward into frame, her fingertip hovering just millimeters above a particular swirling symbol at the map's center, the golden glow intensifying in that specific spot as if drawn to her presence, the light reflecting off her skin and making the fine hairs on the back of her hand visible, Sarah whispers "These markings... they're alive, Marcus" as her finger begins its final approach to touch the surface while her breath causes nearby candle flames to flutter. Realistic style
A rapid pull back explodes outward from close on the map to a wide shot of the entire library at the precise moment Sarah's (mid-twenties, shoulder-length copper-red hair, bright green eyes, worn brown leather jacket with asymmetric zippers over gray cotton shirt, dark jeans, leather boots) fingertip makes contact with the glowing parchment, all the candles in their iron sconces flaring violently and flickering in unison, a column of intense golden light flooding upward from the table in a sudden burst that illuminates both Marcus (late sixties, white beard to chest, round brass spectacles, brown tweed jacket with leather elbow patches over cream cable-knit sweater) and Sarah with harsh brilliance, their faces awash in gold as the shadows in the distant corners between bookshelves seem to deepen and pulse in response to the surge of ancient magic. Realistic style
A low angle shot tilts upward to frame Marcus (late sixties, white beard to chest, round brass spectacles, brown tweed jacket with leather elbow patches over cream cable-knit sweater) from below as he takes two sudden steps backward, his brown tweed jacket swinging with the movement, his chair scraping loudly against the gray flagstones with a harsh grating sound that echoes through the library, his face transitioning rapidly from fascination to alarm as his eyes widen behind his brass spectacles, the intense golden light from the map reflecting in the lenses and obscuring his eyes momentarily, Marcus shouts "Sarah wait, don't touch" but his warning comes too late as she remains transfixed at the table with her finger pressed to the glowing symbols. Realistic style
The camera dollies slowly toward the distant corner between towering black oak bookshelves where candlelight barely reaches, the shadows there seeming to pulse and breathe in rhythm with the map's golden glow, the darkness deepening and shifting as if something massive and unseen is moving within it, the edges of book spines barely visible in the flickering light while the sense of being watched emanates from that black space, dust motes floating through the thin beams of light that penetrate partway into the darkness before being swallowed. Realistic style
An overhead crane shot looks straight down at the wooden table from above, both Marcus's (late sixties, white beard to chest, round brass spectacles, brown tweed jacket with leather elbow patches over cream cable-knit sweater) weathered age-spotted hands visible on the near edge and Sarah's (mid-twenties, shoulder-length copper-red hair, bright green eyes, worn brown leather jacket with asymmetric zippers over gray cotton shirt, dark jeans, leather boots) younger hands on the far edge, her right index finger tracing a glowing line that branches outward from the center of the map, the golden symbols rearranging themselves in real-time in response to her touch, shifting into new geometric configurations and patterns as if the map is actively responding to her will, the light reflecting off the polished wood surface of the table in pools of gold. Realistic style
The camera pushes in smoothly on Sarah's (mid-twenties, shoulder-length copper-red hair, bright green eyes, worn brown leather jacket with asymmetric zippers over gray cotton shirt, dark jeans, leather boots) face in extreme close-up as she lifts her gaze from the glowing map to look up and across the table toward Marcus, the golden light from below still illuminating her features with that eerie uplight, her green eyes catching and holding the glow so they appear to emit light from within, her expression showing a mix of wonder and dawning realization, Sarah asks "What happens when we reach the end, Marcus?" as the question hangs in the air between them while the intensity in her glowing eyes suggests she already senses the answer and fears it. Realistic style
A slow push in tightens on a detail shot of one particular circular glyph symbol near the map's center, this specific symbol pulsing faster and brighter than all the others surrounding it, geometric patterns within the circle shifting and rotating in hypnotic motion, the light it emits almost painful in its intensity, the yellowed parchment around it seeming to darken by contrast, Marcus's voice off-camera says "Once you follow this path, there is no turning back" as we see only the pulsing brilliance of this symbol filling the frame, beating like a living heart. Realistic style
A slow pull back reveals the full library in a final wide shot, Marcus (late sixties, white beard to chest, round brass spectacles, brown tweed jacket with leather elbow patches over cream cable-knit sweater) and Sarah (mid-twenties, shoulder-length copper-red hair, bright green eyes, worn brown leather jacket with asymmetric zippers over gray cotton shirt, dark jeans, leather boots) standing on opposite sides of the wooden table with the column of golden light rising between them like a pillar connecting floor to invisible ceiling, the candles still flickering in their iron sconces along the stone walls, the deep shadows in the distant corners between bookshelves pulsing and breathing in rhythm with the map, the stone archway and dark corridor visible in the background on the left, the entire ancient space suffused with the slow breathing rhythm of magic that has awakened after centuries of sleep, dust motes drifting through golden light beams while neither character moves, frozen in this moment of irrevocable threshold, Sarah finally speaks softly "Then we go forward" as her words seal their fate. Realistic style
Note: If NO style is specified in the input, do NOT add any style tag. Only add the style tag when explicitly provided, and it must match exactly what LLM #2 used.

------ END OF INSTRUCTIONS -----------

nodes.title: INSTRUCTIONS
widgets_values:
INSTRUCTIONS :
LLM #2  CINEMATIC SHOT GENERATOR (Nano Banana / SHOW ME)
Input needed:

Original input text (the raw story/synopsis the user provided)
Complete narrative from LLM #1
Style (if specified - e.g., "Realistic style", "Cartoon style", "Noir style", etc.)
Title (the film/story title - this will appear as text in the first prompt)

Instructions:
Generate image prompts line by line using the Nano Banana "SHOW ME" command structure. You will receive TWO texts to inform your work:

Original input text = the core story intent, pacing, and original creative vision
LLM #1 narrative = detailed visual descriptions, character consistency details, environmental specifics

Read BOTH carefully before generating prompts. Use the original text to understand story priorities and emotional beats. Use the LLM #1 narrative for precise visual continuity and character descriptions.
CRITICAL FORMATTING RULES:

Output prompts line by line with absolutely NO LINE BREAKS between them
NO numbering, NO "Scene 1" or "Scene 2" markers
NO blank lines separating prompts anywhere in your output
Each prompt = one continuous line of text that ends, then immediately the next prompt begins on the following line
THE VERY FIRST PROMPT = TITLE CARD - describe the visual with the title text included
THE SECOND PROMPT = ESTABLISHING SHOT showing the main environment and all characters currently present
All subsequent prompts use "SHOW ME" to request specific views, angles, or focuses
If a style was provided in the input, add it at the END of every single prompt (including the title card)

Title Card Rules (FIRST PROMPT ONLY):

Include the actual title text in the prompt
Describe the visual aesthetic, background, atmosphere, colors, textures that represent the story's mood, it should be a beautiful design
Format: "A title card displaying '[TITLE]' in [font description] against [visual description]"
Examples:

"A title card displaying 'The Ancient Map' in ornate golden letters against ancient weathered parchment texture, golden symbols glowing faintly in the corners, candlelight flickering across the surface"
"A title card displaying 'Shadows of the Library' in elegant serif font against a dark library interior blurred in the background, golden light pulsing from the center"



Nano Banana Command Rules (CRITICAL - applies to prompts AFTER the title card and establishing shot):

The ONLY acceptable command structure is "SHOW ME [what you want to see]"
NEVER use these words: "replace", "change", "modify", "update", "adjust", "alter"
Valid examples:

"show me an aerial view of the library"
"show me Marcus from behind as he unfolds the map"
"show me the glowing symbols in extreme close-up"
"show me Sarah's hands reaching toward the parchment"


Always reintroduce character descriptions from the LLM #1 narrative to maintain consistency
Each "SHOW ME" prompt should feel like you're asking to see a different angle or focus of the ongoing scene

Character & Environment Continuity Rules:

If a character wears specific clothing in the establishing shot, they wear it in every subsequent prompt unless the narrative describes them changing
Maintain spatial relationships: if Sarah enters from the left and stands opposite Marcus, keep this geometry consistent
Track props and their positions: if a candle is on the left corner of the table, it stays there
Lighting sources must remain consistent: if candlelight is the primary source, don't suddenly introduce sunlight
Environmental details must persist: the black oak bookshelves, gray flagstones, iron sconces, stone archwaythese are permanent features
Each prompt must connect logically to the previous one, creating a flowing visual sequence

MAIN CHARACTER DESCRIPTION RULE (CRITICAL):

If there is a main character or any named character in the scene, you MUST include their full physical description in EVERY SINGLE PROMPT where they appear
Character names alone are NOT sufficient - each prompt is independent and must be self-contained
Include age, hair (color, length, style), eye color, clothing (with specific details), and any distinctive physical features
Keep descriptions concise but precise - aim for one flowing sentence that captures their complete appearance
Example: Instead of "show me Marcus looking at the map", write "show me Marcus (late sixties, white beard to chest, round brass spectacles, brown tweed jacket with leather elbow patches over cream cable-knit sweater) looking at the map"
This applies to the establishing shot AND every subsequent "SHOW ME" prompt where the character is visible
If multiple characters appear in a prompt, describe ALL of them fully

Visual Variety Requirements:

Vary your shot distances: wide establishing, medium shots, close-ups, extreme close-ups, detail shots
Vary your angles: eye level, low angle, high angle, overhead, below looking up
Vary your focuses: sometimes the people, sometimes specific objects, sometimes environmental details
Create a rhythm: wide-medium-close, then reset; or establish-detail-detail-pull back

Style Tag Rule:

If a style was specified in the input (e.g., "Realistic style", "Cartoon style", "Anime style", "Film noir style"), you MUST append it to the end of EVERY prompt including the title card
Format: end each prompt with a period, then the style tag
Example: "...her red hair as she takes her first steps into the library. Realistic style"

Output format (no breaks between lines):
A title card displaying 'The Ancient Map' in ornate golden letters against ancient weathered parchment texture filling the frame, golden mystical symbols glowing faintly in the corners, candlelight flickering across the surface creating dancing shadows, the atmosphere mysterious and magical. Realistic style
A wide establishing shot of the ancient library interior with towering black oak bookshelves reaching upward into darkness, gray flagstone floor reflecting candlelight from iron sconces mounted on stone walls, Professor Marcus (late sixties, white beard to chest, round brass spectacles, brown tweed jacket with leather elbow patches over cream cable-knit sweater) standing bent over a massive wooden table at center where an ancient yellowed map glows with golden pulsing symbols, the arched stone doorway visible to the left with corridor beyond disappearing into shadow. Realistic style
Show me a close view of Marcus's (late sixties, white beard to chest, round brass spectacles, brown tweed jacket with leather elbow patches over cream cable-knit sweater) weathered hands with age spots and deep creases as his fingers carefully unfold the ancient animal-skin map across the wooden table surface, golden symbols beginning to glow and pulse with breathing rhythm beneath his touch. Realistic style
Show me Sarah (mid-twenties, shoulder-length copper-red hair, bright green eyes, worn brown leather jacket with asymmetric zippers over gray cotton shirt, dark jeans, leather boots) entering through the arched stone doorway from the shadowed corridor, candlelight catching and illuminating her red hair as she takes her first steps into the library. Realistic style
Show me an overhead view of the wooden table with the glowing map spread across its surface, golden geometric symbols shifting and rearranging themselves, Marcus (late sixties, white beard to chest, round brass spectacles, brown tweed jacket with leather elbow patches over cream cable-knit sweater) standing on one side and Sarah (mid-twenties, shoulder-length copper-red hair, bright green eyes, worn brown leather jacket with asymmetric zippers over gray cotton shirt, dark jeans, leather boots) approaching from the opposite side, their shadows cast long across the gray flagstones by the candlelight. Realistic style
Show me Sarah's (mid-twenties, shoulder-length copper-red hair, bright green eyes, worn brown leather jacket with asymmetric zippers over gray cotton shirt, dark jeans, leather boots) face in close-up as she leans over the table, the golden glow from the map illuminating her features from below, her green eyes wide and reflecting the moving symbols, strands of red hair falling forward past her cheeks. Realistic style
Show me Marcus's (late sixties, white beard to chest, round brass spectacles, brown tweed jacket with leather elbow patches over cream cable-knit sweater) profile from the side as he straightens up slightly, candlelight from the iron sconces catching his face, his round brass spectacles gleaming, deep lines of concern forming across his forehead as he watches Sarah lean closer to the map. Realistic style
Show me an extreme close-up of the map's surface where golden symbols spiral and swirl, the yellowed animal-skin parchment texture visible beneath the glowing geometric patterns that pulse with inner light. Realistic style
Show me Sarah's (mid-twenties, shoulder-length copper-red hair, bright green eyes, worn brown leather jacket with asymmetric zippers over gray cotton shirt, dark jeans, leather boots) right hand and finger extending toward the map surface, her fingertip hovering just millimeters above a particular swirling symbol at the center, the golden glow intensifying around that point of near-contact. Realistic style
Show me a wide shot of the entire library at the moment Sarah's (mid-twenties, shoulder-length copper-red hair, bright green eyes, worn brown leather jacket with asymmetric zippers over gray cotton shirt, dark jeans, leather boots) finger touches the map, all the candles in their iron sconces flaring and flickering violently, the column of golden light flooding upward from the table illuminating both Marcus (late sixties, white beard to chest, round brass spectacles, brown tweed jacket with leather elbow patches over cream cable-knit sweater) and Sarah with harsh brilliance, the distant bookshelves visible in the background with deepening shadows between them. Realistic style
Show me Marcus (late sixties, white beard to chest, round brass spectacles, brown tweed jacket with leather elbow patches over cream cable-knit sweater) from a low angle as he takes a sudden step backward, his brown tweed jacket visible, his chair scraping against flagstones, his face showing alarm as his expression shifts from fascination to concern, his brass spectacles reflecting the intense golden light. Realistic style
Show me the shadows in the distant corner between the bookshelves where darkness seems to pulse and move in rhythm with the map's glow, the edge of black oak shelving barely visible in the flickering candlelight, something unseen watching from that darkness. Realistic style
Show me an overhead shot looking straight down at the map with both Marcus's (late sixties, white beard to chest, round brass spectacles, brown tweed jacket with leather elbow patches over cream cable-knit sweater) weathered hands and Sarah's (mid-twenties, shoulder-length copper-red hair, bright green eyes, worn brown leather jacket with asymmetric zippers over gray cotton shirt, dark jeans, leather boots) younger hands visible, her finger tracing a glowing line that branches outward from center, the symbols rearranging themselves into new patterns in response to her touch, the golden light reflecting off the wooden table surface. Realistic style
Show me Sarah's (mid-twenties, shoulder-length copper-red hair, bright green eyes, worn brown leather jacket with asymmetric zippers over gray cotton shirt, dark jeans, leather boots) face in extreme close-up as she looks up from the map to meet Marcus's gaze, the golden light reflecting in her green eyes making them appear to glow from within, her expression a mix of wonder and realization. Realistic style
Show me a detail shot of a particular circular glyph symbol near the map's center, this one pulsing faster and brighter than all the others around it, geometric patterns within the circle shifting and rotating. Realistic style
Show me a wide final shot of the library with Marcus (late sixties, white beard to chest, round brass spectacles, brown tweed jacket with leather elbow patches over cream cable-knit sweater) and Sarah (mid-twenties, shoulder-length copper-red hair, bright green eyes, worn brown leather jacket with asymmetric zippers over gray cotton shirt, dark jeans, leather boots) standing on opposite sides of the glowing table, the column of golden light between them, candles still flickering in their sconces, deep shadows pulsing in the distant corners, the stone archway and corridor visible in the background, the entire scene suffused with the breathing rhythm of ancient magic. Realistic style
Note: If NO style is specified in the input, do NOT add any style tag. Only add the style tag when explicitly provided.





----END OF INSTRUCTION---------

nodes.title: INSTRUCTIONS
widgets_values:
INSTRUCTIONS :
LLM #1  NARRATIVE EXPANSION & CHARACTER ESTABLISHMENTInput needed:

Raw text (any story, synopsis, screenplay, novel excerpt, etc.)
Instructions:Transform the input text into a detailed, descriptive narrative that will serve as the foundation for visual generation. Your output must be a continuous, flowing text that establishes all characters, environments, and story beats in rich visual detail.Rules:

Write in long-form prose, not bullet points or lists
Establish every character's complete physical appearance the first time they appear (age, build, hair, eyes, clothing, distinctive features)
Describe environments in detail (architecture, materials, lighting quality, atmosphere, weather, props, spatial layout)
Maintain strict continuity throughout - if a character wears a red jacket in one paragraph, they still wear it later unless you explicitly describe them changing
Track character positions and spatial relationships precisely (who stands where, how close, what direction they face)
Note important visual motifs that should recur (specific colors, objects, lighting patterns, architectural details)
Describe lighting sources and quality (candlelight vs. daylight, harsh vs. soft, color temperature)
All videos generated from this will be exactly 8 seconds each
Write fluidly as one continuous block without section breaks, numbering, or chapter divisions
Include sensory details that can be visualized (what things look like, not just what they feel like emotionally)
When characters speak, include their dialogue but always embed it within the visual description of the scene
Output format:One continuous prose block with rich visual detail.
It need ot have a nice story, begin, middle and end. 

YOU NEED TO MAKE A CLEAR BRIEF AT THE BEGIN TO EXPLAIN THE MAIN IDEA


----END OF INSTRUCTION---------

nodes.title: SCENARIO
widgets_values: The adventure arround the world of a Quokka, cartoon style 3d, travelling arround islands. Write something beautiful and with a lot of action, keep it short

groups.title: value0 : NUMBER OF LINE FOR LOOP
value1: line by line for qwenedit prompt
value1: line by line for wan prompt (same as qwen)
